title: What OS can you install on a Raspberry Pi? - Quora

response.answer_text: Anything compatible with the Raspberry Pi’s ARM architecture. Raspbian, Windows 10 IoT, RTOSes, even Android… the sky’s the limit! The officially supported operating system for the Raspberry Pi family of SBCs is Raspbian - a Debian-based Linux distribution optimised for use with the Pi’s low-energy, low-performance ARM CPU. However, you are still free to install any operating system you desire on your Raspberry Pi. There are dozens of ARM-ported Linux distributions out there - Linux Mint, ArchLinux and Ubuntu to mention a few, and non-Linux operating systems such as Windows 10 IoT are also supported. (Note that W10 IoT isn’t the same as the x86 Windows found on desktop computers, but a lighter ARM port of it.) If you really wanted to, you could run an unsupported operating system using a VM or emulator; however, the performance drop could prove to be problematic. Happy hacking!
Pretty much anything that supports its chipset. Having said that, The popular choices are: > Raspbian > “Almost” any linux based Operating Systems > Some version of Windows.
